data

Class FeatureSelection

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.FeatureSelection

  • public class FeatureSelection
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for feature selection in Views. Contains static methods to find special features, standard features and so on.
    Author:
    pwelke

        public static int[] getProbs(View v)
        returns an integer array with indices of all PROB Features
        Parameters:
        v - View to search for PROBs
        Returns:
        array with indices of PROB features or empty array if none are present

      • getSpecialFeatures

        public static int[] getSpecialFeatures(View v)
        Returns an array a of indices of all special features present in a View v. a.length equals the number of special features in v. The array is sorted. That means that the special features are returned in the order that they occur in v.
        Parameters:
        v -
        Returns:

      • extractENVIFeatures

        public static double[][] extractENVIFeatures(View v)
        Calculates and returns the ENVI VIs from http://geol.hu/data/online_help/Vegetation_Indices.html
        Parameters:
        view - - the data View from which the features are calculates
        Returns:
        the VIs (rows are samples/ columns are 20 or 26 VIs)

      • getNonSpecialFeatureDescriptor

        public static double[] getNonSpecialFeatureDescriptor(View v)
        Returns a double array with the description of all Non-Special Features Checks if it is possible to transform them to double values, else returns an array numerated from 1 to numberOfFeatures
        Parameters:
        v - view with data from which to get Feature Descriptors
        Returns:
        double array
